pullRequest.title: Add capability of loading local formatting pattern files

nodes.bodyText: Why do we need a method that is specific to getting the En locale partterns?
Why not patterns = getPatterns(LocaleUtility.getDefaultLocale())?
Why not patterns = getPatterns(LocaleUtility.getDefaultLocale())?
This does not follow the client workflow design. Always try to fetch from the service first even for the default locale, so remove the if-statement block.

Do not use if-else statements to get the message origin from the msgOriginsQueue because the order may change in the future. in other words, .get(0) may not always return DataSourceEnum.VIP even if online mode is supported.
Instead, iterate over msgOriginsQueue. See ComponentService.fetchMessages for reference to do this. Add a createPatternOpt method inside DataSourceEnum.Bundle which will return new LocalePatternOpt(). Add the same method inside DataSourceEnum.VIP which will return new RemotePatternOpt(). Use this DataSourceEnum.createPatternOpt just like in ComponentService.fetchMessages.
If you follow the above, the fallback from online to offline mode (and to any other mode added in the queue in the future) will naturally happen without having to modify this method.

(Same comment as above)
This does not follow the client workflow design. Always try to fetch from the service first even for the default locale, so remove the if-statement block.

(Same comment as above)
Do not use if-else statements to get the message origin from the msgOriginsQueue because the order may change in the future. in other words, .get(0) may not always return DataSourceEnum.VIP even if online mode is supported.
Instead, iterate over msgOriginsQueue. See ComponentService.fetchMessages for reference to do this. Add a createPatternOpt method inside DataSourceEnum.Bundle which will return new LocalePatternOpt(). Add the same method inside DataSourceEnum.VIP which will return new RemotePatternOpt(). Use this DataSourceEnum.createPatternOpt just like in ComponentService.fetchMessages.
If you follow the above, the fallback from online to offline mode (and to any other mode added in the queue in the future) will naturally happen without having to modify this method.

Put this fallback logic in LocaleMessage so that this method here in LocaleService is always for the requested language only.
Once you move the fallback logic into LocaleMessage, update the cache in there in such a way that the key with the requested language is mapped to the FormatCacheItem of the fallback language.
c.put(<cacheKeyOfRequestedLanguage>, new FormatCacheItem(<displayMapofFallbackLanguage>));
Without the above proposed changes, your code will always try to fetch the requested locale first before using the fallback locale that is already in the cache. With the above proposed changes, any succeeding calls for the requested language will immediately return the cached fallback locale until it expires.
Note: You can either put the above logic in LocaleMessage as I propose (just like how it is in TranslationMessage.getMessages), or create another method here in LocaleService to keep the logic in the "service layer".
Are the language names coming from the offline CLDR?

Why not use responseData.isEmpty()  instead of "".equalsIgnoreCase(responseData)?
I saw other instances of this too.

Put this fallback logic in PatternMessage so that this method here in PatternService is always for the requested language only.
Once you move the fallback logic into PatternMessage, update the cache in there in such a way that the key with the requested language is mapped to the FormatCacheItem of the fallback language.
new PatternCacheService().addPatterns(<keyOfRequestedLanguage>, <patternsOfDefaultLanguage>);
Without the above proposed changes, your code will always try to fetch the requested locale first before using the fallback locale that is already in the cache. With the above proposed changes, any succeeding calls for the requested language will immediately return the cached fallback locale until it expires.
Note: You can either put the above logic in PatternMessage as I propose (just like how it is in TranslationMessage.getMessages), or create another method here in PatternService to keep the logic in the "service layer".
Same comment as above (line 50)
Can this be private now? If yes, please change it to private.

Don't need this method because client should get the locale from language and region in offline mode.
In general, Getting Pattern by locale is enough.
Need to log this?
Need to log this?
Need to log this?
Printf-style format strings should be used correctly (squid:S3457)
should  here be English?
Could remove this class?

nodes.bodyText:
Is it correct fallback here?
After normalizing locale, fallback is unnecessary.
Change all region to Territory?
change to "Argument is empty"?
Now client supports multiple configurations, can't get product and version in this way.
unused lines?
Should call ProductService/LocalProductOpt to get this information rather than getting directly.
Suggest move fallback to PatternMessage class. There should a interface to get exact pattern data without fallback.
Move this into PatternCacheService
Suggest to do this in PatternMessage or PatternService.

Let's not have anything hardcoded to English.
In this case, you can leave the dto's display locale as null. It will be handled in the service layer. See code suggestion in LocaleService.

Remove locale parameter, make it a property of LocaleDTO.
See code suggestion for getSupportedLanguagesFromDS below for reference

Remove locale parameter, make it a property of LocaleDTO.
Use fallbackLocalesIter as parameter and recursively call the method to apply locale fallback logic.
See code suggestion for getSupportedDisplayNames below for reference

See my comments in LocaleMessage regarding:

moving the fallback and caching logic in to the service layer
passing Iterator iter = LocaleUtility.getFallbackLocales().iterator() to the service
using a PatternDTO to hold the locale parameter.
In my opinion, pattern is a kind of locale data. So these 2 interfaces may be merged.
Suggest to move this into ProductOpt. It looks better to put all product related interfaces together.
Why do this change?
It has different reasons to failure, locale is just one of them. So I think that no fallback is acceptable.
Default doesn't need to be English. Suggest to search English to see if other similar typos exist.
Cache has been processed in service layer.
Immediately return this expression instead of assigning it to the temporary variable "languageTagList".
It seems this class can have a static instance of PatternService.
Is it necessary to store into cache?
Because this method is about translation. How about put all translation methods into ProductService?

nodes.bodyText: The comment needs update.
Enable this test again. See my comments on not using vipconfig-offline.properties.
See code suggestion for getDisplayNames. Iterate over the fall back locale queue instead of calling LocaleUtility.getDefaultLocale().
Is locale (display language) always required for getPatternMessage? If yes, then ignore my comment above.
No need for this check because there is already a check on line 91 when method is called recursively

This will cause other tests to fail because VIPCFG is a singleton. I had added vipconfig-offline before, but Colin and Xiaochao do not want to use it inside the tests because they say that we should not be able to re-initialize VIPCfg. Hence, that .properties file is not used anymore. Only vipconfig.properties is used, and if I have to modify any property for certain unit tests, I do it inside the test itself. See LocaleTest.testGetSupportedLocalesOfflineBundles for an example.

Same comment: "This will cause other tests to fail because VIPCFG is a singleton. I had added vipconfig-offline before, but Colin and Xiaochao do not want to use it inside the tests because they say that we should not be able to re-initialize VIPCfg. Hence, that .properties file is not used anymore. Only vipconfig.properties is used, and if I have to modify any property for certain unit tests, I do it inside the test itself. See LocaleTest.testGetSupportedLocalesOfflineBundles for an example. "

Hence, that .properties file is not used anymore. Only vipconfig.properties is used, and if I have to modify any property for certain unit tests, I do it inside the test itself. See LocaleTest.testGetSupportedLocalesOfflineBundles for an example. "

Same comment: "This will cause other tests to fail because VIPCFG is a singleton. I had added vipconfig-offline before, but Colin and Xiaochao do not want to use it inside the tests because they say that we should not be able to re-initialize VIPCfg. Hence, that .properties file is not used anymore. Only vipconfig.properties is used, and if I have to modify any property for certain unit tests, I do it inside the test itself. See LocaleTest.testGetSupportedLocalesOfflineBundles for an example. "
It's better to solve the problem instead of commenting it.
Remove this line.
are -> is
Since the '@deprecated' is removed, this 'Deprecated' needs to be removed as well.

Because this is an interface, please keep msgSourceQueueIter internally. Don't include it as a parameter.
The upper layer don't need to know this.
Why "no fallback is acceptable"? If it fails for any reason, why not try the fallback locale?

@huihuiw01 , I am not asking you to pass null to the Singleton service. I am asking to pass null to getDisplayNamesFromCLDR(null), which will call LocaleService.getDisplayNames(null). When LocaleService.getDisplayNames receives a null value, it will get the next item from the fallback locales queue, and use that to pass to the Singleton service. See my code suggestion in LocaleService.getDisplayNames.

It's sure that component and locale are normalized. Don't need to do further procession.

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                                MessagesDTO msgDTO = new MessagesDTO(((String) component).trim(), LocaleUtility.fmtToMappedLocale(Locale.forLanguageTag(languageTag)).toString().trim(),
          
          
            
                                MessagesDTO msgDTO = new MessagesDTO(component, languageTag, dto.getProductID(), dto.getVersion());
FormatUtils.format is heavy and unnecessary.
This logic is scattered across multiple files. It's redundant and error-prone. It's better to merge this kind of logic into one.

commit.message: add L2 pattern files and make some change to support loading them correctly
On offline mode read pattern data from separate jar
Optimize get pattern code & add unit tests for offline mode
Enable offline mode support for getSupportedLanguages and getRegionList API
Adjust L2 API according to new workflow
fix review comments: mainly move fallback logic to outer layer and other minor comments
Change supportedLanguage API to support multiple configurations
fix CI reported issue: add license and copyright header for new added files
fix review comments: move fallback logic to service layer
fix review comment: use LocaleDTO instead of BaseDTO as data transfer object for parameter scalability
fix some minor review comments
fix NullPointerException in DateFormatting when default locale's pattern is not available
fix unit tests failure problems reported in CI

commit.message: fix review comment: optimize one log

nodes.bodyText:
I made a mistake of not adding .toString() to p.getFileName(). I have updated the code suggestion.
Files.walk will iterate over ALL paths -- all folders AND files inside the root path and  the root path itself. So yes, it will apply to files as well.  The .filter part will check if each item is a file (not a folder) that starts with BUNDLE_PREFIX and ends with BUNDLE_SUFFIX. If one of these conditions fail, the item will not be included in listOfFiles. This way, you do not need the if statement.
You also do not need to return an empty String so that you can remove if(language != null && !language.isEmpty())
Test the code suggestion above and see if it works. I have tested it and seems to be no problem.

commit.message: Use Files.list which is non-recursive when getting offline component list
fix review comment: optimize code for getting supported locales
